website_summaries.verdict: A fully assembled rocket that reaches a height of up to 1,100 feet.
pros: This beginner-friendly model rocket comes ready-to-fly out of the box and accepts several engine types
If you are not interested in meticulously assembling your rocket, this is a great choice
This rocket launches reliably and flies straight
cons: You will need to purchase launch gear and engines separately

customer_reviews.title: Excellent First Launch Rocket
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter (who bears the same name), and we just finished our initial launch(es). It was excellent. This is a simple, straight-flying rocket that we were able to recover and launch a total of three times (before we ran out of A8 engines). We'll try some B6 engines, next, and I suspect this rocket will last for as long as we can successfully find / recover it. The rocket comes pre-assembled, with easy instructions to pack it together and launch. Note: This is the rocket only. It does not come with a launch pad, igniter, wadding or engines. You'll need all of those before you can blast off.
customer_reviews.author: Double E

customer_reviews.title: Slip the surly bonds of earth with these rockets
customer_reviews.text: You can use A, B or C level rocket boosters with this little guy. Fair warning to the C level rocket booster: this will fly high and probably not come back down. I think mine's still in lower orbit, zipping by the International Space Station and probably causing alien 'sightings'. All in all it's a great little starter rocket. Easy to snap together and set up. Pay mind to how to properly wrap the parachute. If you don't, the rocket will come back to earth and taking the express elevator. Goin' down!
customer_reviews.author: Frequency JonesTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Great rocket for the price
customer_reviews.text: First of all this is not a toy, but rather a ready-to-fly rocket. We just needed to attach the chute. I bought two and launched them twice each in drag race fashion on C5-6's at a high-power rocketry event. They flew straight, high and well. The chutes deployed properly and retrieved both of them undamaged. I am Level Two certified though Tripoli. (Look it up.) Make sure to read the instructions and have proper supervision when launching this model rocket. When used properly, you should have a great time. I've ordered another Athena to add to the drag race fleet. I've not had any problems with the Estes ready-to-fly rockets.
customer_reviews.author: ParkSDTop Contributor: Sewing

customer_reviews.title: Fun pre-built
customer_reviews.text: My son has about 6 or 7 launches on this rocket. It's almost a perfect launch every time, but the chute seems to have a hard time fully opening in time. Also, the tube just above where the rocket motor fires is getting weak (Probably burning out). Otherwise a really fun rocket (We launch it in calm conditions in the street and it's only "almost" went on a roof once).
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for beginners!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Estes for years. I now have introduced my grand daughter to model rockets. This is a good rocket for seven years as there really is not anything for her to construct. We just enjoy launching. Remember you need wadding to use the rocket more then once!
customer_reviews.author: James. Backus

customer_reviews.title: It is very much a basic start-up but will do nicely in introducing my children to rocket propulsion
customer_reviews.text: Put it together already, now just waiting for the weather to warm up. Not much to putting this rocket together. It is very much a basic start-up but will do nicely in introducing my children to rocket propulsion.
customer_reviews.author: ATM

customer_reviews.title: This thing flys like a rocket.
customer_reviews.text: Even with the smallest engines that will fit, this thing goes so high in the sky it's hard to fallow. Don't get the larger engines unless you want to run a mile to get it back.
customer_reviews.author: K. Holt

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent rocket. Just make sure you have enough space. I used a B series engine and although I didn't have an altimeter, I lost it on a clear day at first. Straight accent and parachute opened perfectly. Took so long for it to descend that it ended up in a dead tree. Bought another one, since it was so inexpensive and performed so well. All you have to do is attach the parachute and install the engine and it is ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: John J. Smitley

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: So easy to assemble, almost usable out of the box. Very durable. Launches over and over
customer_reviews.author: Claire Press

customer_reviews.title: Great beginners rocket for kids not yet able to build a rocket
customer_reviews.text: It pretty much is launchable right out of the box - the only assembly needed is to attach the parachute. We went from the box to a launch in about a half hour - including the drive to the park from our house. For younger kids this is the perfect rocket to get them hooked.
customer_reviews.author: Sully

customer_reviews.title: Read to launch (and lose) out of the box
customer_reviews.text: This is ready to launch out of the box with only the parachute to attach. It performs great and goes quite a distance 1,100 ft+ with a C-sized engine. We've already lost 3! If you're looking to get to the field/sky quickly, this is a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: IBuyTooMuchOnAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Comes assembled for kids that don’t want to heat about “letting the glue dry”.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, rocket is ready to go out of the package. You just need a launch pad, launch controller and a pack of engines (engines come with starters and plugs) and you are in business. I would suggest buying a kit that contains rockets, the launch pad and controller as well as this rocket. That way you can launch this one while you are building the others. I wouldn’t go past a b engine on this one without a really big field and a calm day.
customer_reviews.author: D.Black

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect it to come home
customer_reviews.text: First launch was good because the parachute didn't activate because we didn't pack it right. Second launch that sucker went right into the sun and I swear something grabbed it because that was the last I ever saw it.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to put together and good launcher
customer_reviews.text: I put this together with my kids. It was a fun and easy build. We did lose it the first time we launched it as we lost the sightline. This is a good one and a good brand.
customer_reviews.author: Mn poet 09

customer_reviews.title: Great Starter Rocket
customer_reviews.text: Great starter rocket... if you only need a rocket. Basically fully assembled, ready to fly in about 4 minutes. Note that you will need all the materials (launch pad, engine, etc.) to make it fully work though.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great choice for an easy blast off!
customer_reviews.text: I used this rocket for a rocket blast off for my Sunday School children. They loved to watch the rocket blast into the air. I was pleased with the ease of use and the good instructions that were included.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Just like I remembered
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rocket for my son on his Birthday. We finally got an opportunity to launch and had such a great memory making experience. The rocket flew quite well as we were able to achieve 4 successful rocket launches and recoveries.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Good value.
customer_reviews.text: My 2 and 3 year olds love it. No assembly required, and I don’t get stressed if it gets stuck in a tree. I would prefer a lower “disposable” price.
customer_reviews.author: Zack D

customer_reviews.title: Easy peasy.
customer_reviews.text: Lack engine and paper wading. Ready to fly otherwise. No glues, stickers or directions. Light that sum bitch up and take off!
customer_reviews.author: T.J.K.

customer_reviews.title: Good medium sized rocket with no assembly required
customer_reviews.text: I like this rocket because there is no assembly required. Good medium sized rocket. Shot it off 6x with my son. Worked great, although the metal clip that holds the engine in came off on the 2nd flight...but isn't really needed unless you want the used engine back to avoid littering.
customer_reviews.author: bptexas

customer_reviews.title: Get started quickly
customer_reviews.text: This is very easy to get ready and use. It works well with both B and C engines. The parachute has been reliable in the ~10 flights so far.
customer_reviews.author: Computer Dude

customer_reviews.title: Really good rocket
customer_reviews.text: My son have activity with this rocket and it’s really good. It can be launched 20m night, we had a good time with it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High flyer!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for beginners! If you use the more powerful engines, like the c6 series. Have plenty of room for recovery. This thing goes!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pre Built
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if I over looked it in the description or not but this rocket is pre assembled. Was initially disappointed after seeing that it was already built the was quickly happy after first launch when it went out of sight and was never seen again. This thing goes HIGH!!!
customer_reviews.author: Consumer Reports

customer_reviews.title: Not everything you need is in the box
customer_reviews.text: Please know that you will still need to buy several other things to make this rocket fly.
customer_reviews.author: 💞Suzanne💞

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: My kids had a blast with this rocket. Easy to assemble and works as expected.
customer_reviews.author: V. Calderon

customer_reviews.title: Ready to go and flies straight
customer_reviews.text: All assembled and delivers a great flight! Engines not included.
customer_reviews.author: PopeyeMagoo

customer_reviews.title: Ehh
customer_reviews.text: While this was a ready to use rocket, it wasn’t worth the money. This thing sailed so high into the sky(clear sky, no wind), that nearly a dozen people that were watching lost sight of it. Needles to say it did not come down. Not worth my sons tears.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Good product!
customer_reviews.text: Flew very well.... long story short I lost mine, need a bigger field
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Timeless Memories
customer_reviews.text: My son absolutely loved building this rocket. I got into model rockets when I was his age. Estes is going to be around forever.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Confirms Newton everytime
customer_reviews.text: A dependable flyer everytime. Used for 1st Grade Science demonstration for Newton's laws
customer_reviews.author: Skinner

customer_reviews.title: For a quick launch these work great. And inexpensive enough that you don't cry when ...
customer_reviews.text: For a quick launch these work great. And inexpensive enough that you don't cry when you hang one in a tree.
customer_reviews.author: Woodrow01

customer_reviews.title: Just make sure you have enough space to land
customer_reviews.text: The Athena is an amazing rocket and flew like a charm even using a B engine, just make sure you have enough room to get it back because I lost mine in someone's back yard.
customer_reviews.author: Trent glass

customer_reviews.title: 5 yr old first rocket!
customer_reviews.text: My son is five and absolutely loves this rocket! Using the A engine the rocket doesn’t go up too high and is easy to retrieve.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to see if your little one catches the rocket bug!
customer_reviews.text: Great first rocket! All that it needs is to have the included parachute tied to the nose cone.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Rocket
customer_reviews.text: If model Rocketry is your thing, a must have, flies straight and true

customer_reviews.title: Great For Beginners
customer_reviews.text: This is very easy to get started with and works like a charm. Great for first-timers.
customer_reviews.author: Wanzi

customer_reviews.title: this is a great low price option and minimal assembly
customer_reviews.text: this is a great low price option and minimal assembly. my son and i love it. we have bought two after i lost the first (no fault to the product, we used a B engine too close to the trees!)
customer_reviews.author: Boiler53

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Doesnt come with stand to launch so buy it when you purchase this also I reccomend buying extra motor

customer_reviews.title: Estes rockets
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much already built. launched it a whole bunch a couple weekend ago. very fun

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: We bought 14 of these for a massive rocket party for 14 kids. They were awesome, held together, launched flawlessly and were of remarkably consistent and high quality. I would buy them without hesitation again. With the largest motors, they were almost out of sight... :)

customer_reviews.title: this baby goes super
customer_reviews.text: careful with the C engines, this baby goes super high

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.text: I liked that no assembly was required. No dry time needed for paint or glue. Was ready to fly directly out of the box. Would recommend to a beginner rocketeer

customer_reviews.text: Wow - very successful with multiple launches. Very happy boys.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good rocket. Don't use A8-3 engines, they won't push this rocket up very high.

customer_reviews.title: No stickers to install color on the body already no glue needed

customer_reviews.text: Wow, I didn't realize I was buying a rocket that was already built and painted! If you just want to fly a great looking rocket without a couple days of prep time waiting for glue/paint to dry then this is the way to go. I may buy some more of this style in the future.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: My family and I like it very much. Thank you very much.

customer_reviews.title: This rocket preformed amazingly i suggest using C6-5 engines if ...
customer_reviews.text: This rocket preformed amazingly i suggest using C6-5 engines if you are into height although they are on the expensive side, If you are on a budget the B6-4 engines work just as well. Overall 5/5

customer_reviews.title: Easy For Beginners and Young kids
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my son very easy just attach the chute and it’s ready to fly. He has flown it about 6 times now and it’s holding up well

customer_reviews.title: It takes off quickly and flies nice and straight
customer_reviews.text: It takes off quickly and flies nice and straight. I replaced the parachute with a streamer because it seems pretty light for the parachute that comes with it.

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, easy to assemble and it flies very high.
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old son thought it was the best present ever. It flies out of sight and parachutes down so you can launch it again.

customer_reviews.title: but very nice little rocket
customer_reviews.text: not big enough to fit an 808 keychain camera, but very nice little rocket; flying on b6-4 about 20 launches no issues (survided undeployed shoot once) and was lost in the wind on the last voyage

customer_reviews.title: Good starter rocket
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to assemble and flies very high...so high that we've lost both of the ones we've launched (the first one was on a windy day so we should've known better).

customer_reviews.title: See my youtube
customer_reviews.text: This works AMAZING!!! It is the perfect dimension for the rocket launcher I built. I have hence named my launcher after this rocket in honor of it. Great job Estes!!! Keep this model forever PLEASE!!!! It is the best one yet!!

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: This model is ready to go right out of the box I gotten it to build alongside my girlfriends son Ahhh well

customer_reviews.title: Good deal!
customer_reviews.text: We had a rocket day .. It performed well!! It may have even flown so far it got lost...

customer_reviews.title: Shot super high on a C engine
customer_reviews.text: Ready to go out of box. Shot super high on a C engine.

customer_reviews.title: Simple
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to assemble. Disappeared after first or second flight. Stick with smaller motors unless you have 0 wind!
customer_reviews.author: Corey Schrader

customer_reviews.title: Great ready to fly rocket.
customer_reviews.text: Great ready to fly rocket. My 4 year old son loves rockets and put this in my cart without me knowing and purchased it.

customer_reviews.title: No parachute
customer_reviews.text: Don't use the parachute, just the elastic, and you will recover the rocket, otherwise say goodbye

customer_reviews.title: Good quality....but...
customer_reviews.text: Rocket flew nicely as expected but did not come with the stuffing paper which is needed to launch. Luckily someone else in our group had extra.

customer_reviews.title: My bad.
customer_reviews.text: It flew well. Only flew once because it went into a tree. My bad.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great rocket for boy scout rocket launch...super easy to use. make sure you order engines and wadding separately.

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. Launched it 6 times and everything is still in great shape. Had a blast with my nephews for their birthday!

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: Launch was awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Coming from someone who "just wanted to launch a rocket", with not any expectations, no problems what so ever! Launch was awesome!

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Rocket
customer_reviews.text: Best rocket I've bought to date!! Comes assembled & launches perfectly. Would definitely buy again if I can't find it after future launches.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Schlenner

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Rocket. Not a Toy!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent rocket. No messing around with glue etc. Fired off well. Parachute worked - all good. Also tried it without the parachute - when it returned it buried itself in the (hard) ground 2 inches deep. Bit of a wake up call not to misuse these rockets.
customer_reviews.author: GFDS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent rocket!
customer_reviews.text: My 6-year old wanted to have a rocket of her own to fly on a day when her older brother was flying his with his science club buddies. The rocket was slightly larger than others at the event, and caused some envy :) The rocket was flown five times, with different types of engines, and held up really well. We hope to use it again next year.
customer_reviews.author: Margarita Savoy

customer_reviews.title: ... gift but was not well-made and didn't work that great, in addition to missing a part
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a gift but was not well-made and didn't work that great, in addition to missing a part. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Tammi Nowack

customer_reviews.title: Goes out of sight. Make sure you have lots ...
customer_reviews.text: Goes out of sight. Make sure you have lots of room to launch it and no wind. Launched it about 8 times so far with the C65.

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars

customer_reviews.title: Not for educators.
customer_reviews.text: Flies very nicely, but of little use for educators, as it's practically out-of-box. No chance to teach the science. Looks good, though!

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: CHEAP quality compared to what the Athena rocket used to be for the same price--VERY flimsy fuselage tube!

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: On the first launch, the cord separated from the rocket body. My daughter watched as the parachute and nose cone drifted away and the rocket tumbled into a neighborhood, adjacent to the park we launched from.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor instructions and more!
customer_reviews.text: The instructions would have been impossible for a ten year old to follow, let alone many adults. Went through two packs of engines before finding igniters that worked. Went to Utube to get good instructions that worked. However they are amazing to see fly.

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed. Gift was a Christmas present but when I ...
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Gift was a Christmas present but when I opened he box I needed to buy additional items for it to work. This was not stated in description

customer_reviews.title: super
customer_reviews.text: used as a contest prize for a birthday party. never actually got to see how it worked or if it worked well, but seen the same type of models sold at various stores.

customer_reviews.title: Pre-assembled Rocket
customer_reviews.text: This only comes with the rocket so if you are looking for an all inclusive kit that includes everything you need (except for the engines) then look elsewhere. I really enjoyed this rocket as it was quick and simple to setup. All I had to do was attach the parachute the nose of the rocket and it was ready for lift off. No gluing, sanding, etc needed with this setup!
customer_reviews.author: Arthur

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to assemble with some adult help. Fly's really high! Kids love it. Pretty impressive.

customer_reviews.title: Estes 2452 Athena Flying Model Rocket Kit
customer_reviews.text: Haven't flown it yet but it looks great and the price was right.
customer_reviews.author: Biff

product_meta.title: Estes 2452 Athena Flying Model Rocket Kit
product_meta.description:
Color:Brown/aIn a hurry with no time to build or are you just looking for another GREAT flying, high performance rocket to add to your collection? Estes has just the rocket for you! the Athena is a fully assembled, great looking, high-flying model rocket. Launched on standard Estes engines, The Athena can reach heights of 1100 feet and is easily recovered with 12 inch, brightly colored, fully assembled parachute. Perfect for a hobbyist looking to start in rocketry or for use as a cool, science kit to spark kids interests in aerospace and Engineering. what you need to build: ready to fly rocket. No building, gluing or painting required. what you need to launch (sold separately): Estes model rocket engines, starters and recovery wadding. Four 1. 5V High quality AA alkaline batteries are also required for Launch controller (Not Included).

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
In a hurry with no time to build or are you just looking for another great flying, high performance rocket to add to your collection? Estes has just the rocket for you. The Athena is a fully assembled, great looking, high-flying model rocket. Launched on standard Estes engines, the Atehna can reach heights of 1100 feet and is easily recovered with 12 inch, brightly colored, fully assembled parachute. Estes model rocketry is recommended for ages 10 and up with adult supervision for those under 12. Unless otherwise specified, all models require assembly. Tools, construction and finishing supplies sold separately.
feature_bullets: WHAT YOU NEED TO LAUNCH (sold separately): Estes Porta-Pad II Launch Pad with a 1/8 inch launch rod and Electron Beam Launch Controller, Estes model rocket engines, starters and recovery wadding. Four 1.5V high quality AA alkaline batteries are also required for launch controller (not included)

specifications.Included Components: Estes Rockets 2452 Athena Model Rocket Kit, Rtf
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars410 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
